author: Phil Vickery
method: Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. In a bowl, mix together the flour and enough yoghurt to form a firm dough. Roll out on a flat surface to 2Â½/1in thickness and using a chefs' ring, cut into rounds. Heat a frying pan and add the dough rounds. Dry fry until the scones have puffed up and browned a little. For the plums, place the plums on a baking sheet. Place in the oven and bake for five minutes, until they have softened slightly. Meanwhile, place the blackcurrant conserve in a small saucepan with a splash of water and warm over a low heat. Remove the plums from the oven and cover with the warm blackcurrant conserve. Return to the oven for a further three minutes. To serve, place the scones onto a dish with the plum mixture poured over.
ingredients: 85g/3oz self-raising flour,  Greek yoghurt, to bind,  3 plums, halved and stones removed,  1 jar blackcurrant conserve
